bibl.title: Letter from Pedro Nogueira to Philip Showalter Hench, November 23, 1952

div1.p: Nogueira discusses preparations for the dedication of Camp Lazear. He informs Hench that the President of Cuba will participate in the ceremony. Nogueira hints that family members of the Yellow Fever Board members will receive the Finlay Medal from the Cuban government.

div1.head: Letter from Pedro Nogueira to Philip Showalter Hench, November 23, 1952
div1.opener:
DR. PEDRO NOGUEIRA
MEDICO CIRUJANO
MARTI 219, MARIANAO
Marianao Noviembre 23 of 1952
TELEFONO: B0-7577
Dr Philip Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnessota
U.S.A.
Dear Philip:
div1.p:
Your letter November 18th has been very pleasant to
me, above all to know that Mayo Clinic has joined to the homenage
act, we prepared and I esteem, that flowers wreath will be very
pretty to be placed at the beginning of the act at Lazear Camp,
and may be when you come we will discuss to place another in the
Clinic name, on Dr Finlay tomb at the cementery on the official
act we celebrate every year on the said place.

Also I would be glad you bring the copies of the address in
spanish, why so easier for everybody and with pleasure we will
revise the text to your desire, although I am sure their will be
no reason to modify it, because you know almost like I the cubans.

Is is lamentable that Hanberry is unable to attend the act,
why that was the most sentimental part of it; but I hope to reco-
mend somebody else, joined on that days can unveil the busts and
plates (may be Mrs Ames).-

The invitations ypu ask for I will have them, for when you co-
me; I must add you ought to have received already 20 I sent you
but right now, you will receive one, especially from the President
of the Republic, which he mailed to every persons that you know
(including the last letter November 18).- I steem it would be
must appreciated by you.

With regard to the question about Dr Claudio Delgado I inform
DR. PEDRO NOGUEIRA
MEDICO CIRUJANO
MARTI 219. MARIANAO
2
TELEFONO: B0-7577
you, he was graduated Physicians at Havana, 1878.- I have his
biography nearly complete and any date about Dr Delgado I have
them.- Beside on Cuba is alive yet his widow and son, who we will
have much pleasure to introduce you, when you come.
The subject of address on Lazear Camp, as you pointed is alright

Much pleased that you come to the act at the Academy on the
night 3ord December and I inform you, that you wont have to speak
over there.- I am pleased to inform you too, at the act Lazear Camp
ist the same Academy the President of the Republic promised to
attend.

Philip although I am not sure, because it is not on the official
Presidential Decree, I think their have been condecorated every per
sons family of the members of the Commision, that we talked about.
Beside Hanberry, Mrs Ames, Cooke (as postum homenage).- When you
get here, I am sure to have the list complete and official of the
condecorated on the night 3rd Deccember.- Keep these dates yet on
secret.-

I wrote Lambert again at his new address, that you sent me and
mailed him invitation for the act.- I wish to point out that Lam-
bert was also proposed for condecoration and I am sure he will be.

I received letter from General Armstrong where he tell me of
the designation Gen Streit to attend the act.- Philip I wish to
know exactly in what fly Miami-Havana you will come.- Your ticket
must have reservation for that fly and the number of the same is
what interest me, to know the exact hour of your arrival.- In case
no other urgent matter I think this my last letter till you come,
where I will be wainting you at the airport.
Many regards for Mary and so long:
